Package option

Interface ForwardingOption<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Option<T>
    public interface ForwardingOption<T>
extends Option<T>
    ForwardingOption is a utility interface that functions as a wrapper around any given Option and delegates calls to the inner Option.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface option.Option

        Option.Action

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default <R> Option<R> flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
      Given a function which takes an instance of type T as input, if the object is Some, this method will return the result of applying that method to the inner object.
      Option<T> inner()  
      default Option<T> orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)
      The None-counterpart to flatMap.
      default T unwrap()
      Extraction method to retrive the inner object if present.

      • Methods inherited from interface option.Option

        and, andThen, contains, expect, filter, flatten, ifNone, ifSome, isNone, isSome, isSomeAnd, map, mapOr, mapOrElse, matches, okOr, okOrElse, or, stream, unwrapOr, unwrapOrElse, xor

    • Method Detail

      • inner

        Option<T> inner()

      • unwrap

        default T unwrap()
        Description copied from interface: Option
        Extraction method to retrive the inner object if present. It is bad practice to call this method unless the client code can guarantee there is an object present.
        Specified by:
        unwrap in interface Option<T>

      • flatMap

        default <R> Option<R> flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
        Description copied from interface: Option
        Given a function which takes an instance of type T as input, if the object is Some, this method will return the result of applying that method to the inner object.
        Specified by:
        flatMap in interface Option<T>
        Type Parameters:
        R - The inner type of the new option

      • orElse

        default Option<T> orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)
        Description copied from interface: Option
        The None-counterpart to flatMap. Returns the Option returned by the passed function, in case of the None-variant, otherwise the method returns its own instance.
        Specified by:
        orElse in interface Option<T>
